composition: Paracetamol; K sorbate; white scored f-c
dosage: Admin with water, other fluid every 4-6 hrs as needed. Use lowest effective dose for shortest poss duration. Adults, children > 12 yrs: 500-1000 mg (1-2 tabs); max 4 g (8 tabs)/day. Children 7-12 yrs: 250-500 mg (1/2-1 tab); max 2 g (4 tabs)/day

foodData.text: May be taken with or without food.

product.adverseReactions: Very rare: thrombocytopenia, cutaneous hypersensitivity (incl rash, SCAR), anaphylaxis, bronchospasm, hepatic dysfunction
product.drugInteractions: Coumarins eg warfain; chloramphenicol; drugs affecting gastric emptying eg metoclopramide, propantheline, anticholinergic antidepressants, narcotic analgesics; hepatotoxics; liver microsomal enzyme inducers eg alcohol, anticonvulsants; probenecid; colestyramine (within 1 hr); other paracetamol containing products
product.precautions: Hepatic, renal impairment; persistent symptoms; > recommended dose; prolonged use (> a few days in adults, > 48 hrs in children 7-17 yrs); glutathione depletion eg severe malnourishment, anorexia, low BMI, chronic heavy alcoholic use, sepsis; aspirin, other NSAID sensitivity (incr bronchospasm risk); children < 7 yrs (tabs, Mini Caps not recommended), < 10 yrs (suppositories not recommended)
product.uses: Analgesic, antipyretic. Temporary relief of pain (incl period, sinus), discomfort assoc with headache (incl migraine, tension), backache, toothache, muscular ache, arthritis (incl osteo), cold, flu symptoms; fever

product.uses: Analgesic, antipyretic. Temporary relief of pain (incl period, sinus), discomfort assoc with headache (incl migraine, tension), backache, toothache, muscular ache, arthritis (incl osteo), cold, flu symptoms; fever

dosage: Insert into rectum up to 4 times/24 hrs as needed; min dose interval 4 hrs; may moisten prior to use to ease insertion. Use lowest effective dose for shortest poss duration. Adults, > 12 yrs: 1000 mg (2 suppos); max 4 g (8 suppos)/24 hrs. Children 10-12 yrs: 500 mg (1 suppos); max 2 g (4 suppos)/24 hrs
